tit.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。統一リストに合わせて表記を変えました。

sen.j: 観世小次郎信光（かんぜ こじろう のぶみつ、觀世小次郎信光、永享7年（1435年）または宝徳2年（1450年） - 永正13年（1516年）7月7日）は日本の室町時代の猿楽師（能楽師）、猿楽（能）作者。
sen.e: Nobumitsu KANZAKOJIRO (1435 or 1450 - July 7, 1516) is a Sarugaku (form of popular Japanese entertainment dating from at least the 11th century, which helped give rise to the noh and kyogen forms of drama) actor (noh actor), and a Sarugaku (noh) play writer.
sen.cmt: 猿楽の説明を加えています。
sen.e: Nobumitsu KANZAKOJIRO (1435 or 1450 - July 7, 1516) is a Sarugaku (form of popular Japanese entertainer dating from at least the 11th century, which helped give rise to noh and kyogen forms of drama) actor (noh actor), and a Sarugaku (noh) play writer.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Kojiro Nobumitsu KANZE (1435 or 1450 - August 15, 1516) was a Sarugakushi (an actor of Sarugaku (early form of the Japanese classical drama Noh) and a Nohgakushi (an actor of Noh)), and a playwright of Sarugaku (Noh).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。統一リストに合わせて表記を変えました。

tit.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 世阿弥の甥音阿弥の第七子として生まれる。
sen.e: Nobumitsu was born as the seventh child of Onami (a nephew of Zeami (a founder of the noh theater), and a top sarugaku actor throughout his life).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: Nobumitsu was born the seventh child of Onami (a nephew of Zeami (a founder of the noh theater), and a top sarugaku actor throughout his life).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: He was born as the seventh child of Onami, a nephew of Zeami (Zeami founded the Noh theater with his father Kanami).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。原文に合わせました。

sen.j: （生年については従来1435年といわれていたが、近年表章などの研究により1451年説が有力になってきており、この項では両説を併記した）。
sen.e: (Traditionally, people have considered that he was born in 1435, but according to recent studies by Akira OMOTE and other researchers, he is more likely to have been born in 1451; here, we have adopted the both.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理上記では、「觀世小次郎信光、永享7年（1435年）または宝徳2年（1450年） - 」となっていますが、ここでは、「1451年説」となっていますが、そのまま訳しています。
sen.e: (Traditionally, people have considered that he was born in 1435, but according to recent studies by Akira OMOTE and other researchers, he is more likely to have been born in 1451; here, we have adopted both.)
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: (It has traditionally been said that he was born in 1435, but according to recent researchers including Akira OMOTE, he was more likely to be born in 1451; therefore, both of the years are described here).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。原文に合わせました。

sen.j: いずれにせよ信光が生まれた頃には、観世座の主導権は世阿弥父子から音阿弥家へと移行していた。
sen.e: In any event, by the time he was born, Kanze za (one of four safugaku schools in Yamato Province) had been led by the Onami family, not by Zeami and his son (Kanami) as it used to be.
sen.cmt: この場合「大夫」とは、猿楽座の座長（大辞泉）をさすので、大夫以下その他の役者をさすと解しています。一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: By the time he was born, Kanze za (one of four safugaku schools in Yamato Province) had been led by the Onami family, not by Zeami and his son (Kanami) as it used to be.
sen.cmt: wordiness
sen.e: Whichever year was correct, leadership of the Kanze troupe (one of four sarugaku troupes in Yamato Province) had been transferred from Zeami and his son to the Onami family by the time Nobumitsu was born.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 彼の生涯はその音阿弥直系の大夫たちを補佐することに捧げられることとなる。
sen.e: Inevitably, his life was devoted to supporting the tayu (chairman of the school) and actors of the Onami family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: His life was devoted to supporting the tayu (chairman of the school) and actors of the Onami family.
sen.cmt: wordiness
sen.e: He devoted his life to assisting tayu (head of a troupe) which was inherited by the direct descendants of the Onami family.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 音阿弥の弟・弥三郎に師事し、はじめ大鼓方をつとめていた。
sen.e: He studied under Yasaburo, a younger brother of Onami, and started his career as an Otsuzumikata (player of a Japanese drum).
He studied under Yasaburo, a younger brother of Onami, and started his career as an Otsuzumikata (player of a Japanese drum).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He learned to play Otsuzumi (hourglass-shaped Japanese large hand drum) under the instruction of Yasaburo, a younger brother of Onami, and started his career as an Otsuzumi kata (Otsuzumi player).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 景徐周鱗の書いた「観世小次郎信光画像讃」や『四座役者目録』などよると、15歳の時後花園天皇の御前での猿楽に参加し, 天皇の扇を同席した足利義政の手添えで授けられるという栄誉を受けたという。
sen.e: According to "Kanzekojiro Nobumitsu ga zo-san" (literally, "Nobumitsu KANZAKOJIRO's Drawings with Poems") and "Yoza yakusha mokuroku" (literally, "List of Actors of Four Sarugaku Schools") written by Shurin KEIJI (a zen priest and a poet), he took part in a Sarugaku play performed before Emperor Gohanazono at fifteen, and was given the Emperor's fan by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, the eighth shogun of the Ashikaga shogunate, who was there to watch the play with the Emperor, to honor his performance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: According to "Kanzekojiro Nobumitsu ga zo-san" (literally, "Nobumitsu KANZAKOJIRO's Drawings with Poems") and "Yoza yakusha mokuroku" (literally, "List of Actors of the Four Sarugaku Schools") written by Shurin KEIJI (a zen priest and a poet), he took part in a Sarugaku play performed before Emperor Gohanazono at fifteen, and was given the Emperor's fan by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, the eighth shogun of the Ashikaga shogunate, who was there to watch the play with the Emperor, to honor his performance.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: According to 'KANZE Kojiro Nobumitsu ga zo-san' (inscription to the portrait of Kojiro Nobumitsu KANZE) and "Yoza yakusha mokuroku" (Catalog of Actors of the Four Troupes) written by KEIJO Shurin (abbot of Nanzen-ji Temple in Kyoto), when the 15-year-old Nobumitsu took part in a Sarugaku performed before Emperor Gohanazono, the Emperor gave Nobumitsu a fan to honor his performance through Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA who watched Sarugaku with the Emperor.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しスペル修正しました。

sen.j: 早くからその才能を表していた。
sen.e: He had remarkable talent from an early age.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: He had remarkable talent from an early age.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He had remarkable talent from an early age.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 傍流の囃方という身ではあったが、時の観世大夫 観世三郎之重が幼少であったため、それを助ける形で活発な活動を見せた。
sen.e: Although he played a minor role as a Hayashikata (musician in noh), he had opportunities to show his outstanding performance while supporting young Yukishige KANZESABURO, the chairman of the Kanze za school.

Although he played a minor role as a Hayashikata (musician in noh), he had the opportunity to show his outstanding performance while supporting young Yukishige KANZESABURO, the chairman of the Kanze za school.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Although he was from a branch family and a Hayashikata (musician), he actively involved in assisting Saburo Yukishige KANZE, then tayu of the KANZE troupe, since Yukishige was young.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。表記、表現を変えました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: 前述の『四座役者目録』は「乱舞道の名人」、また諸道において暗きところなし、と評している。
sen.e: In "Yoza yakusha mokuroku" mentioned above, he was praised as "the master of sarugaku, who excels at everything".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: In "Yoza yakusha mokuroku" mentioned above, he was praised as "the master of sarugaku, who excels at everything".
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In "Yoza yakusha mokuroku" mentioned above, he was praised as 'the master of sarugaku' and excelled at everything.
sen.cmt: 「"the master of sarugaku, who excels at everything".」→「'the master of sarugaku' and excelled at everything.」としました。

sen.j: 囃方という枠にとらわれず、役者としても優れていたことが窺える。
sen.e: This reveals that he did not confine himself to a hayashikata; he was a talented actor as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: This reveals that he did not confine himself to a hayashikata; he was a talented actor as well.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This shows that he was free from the limitation of classification as Hayashikata and was also prominent as an actor.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: ことに彼の子孫にワキ方の役者が多かったことから、ワキの名人だったともいう（『四座役者目録』の記述を信用しない説もある）。
sen.e: He may have been the master of Waki (supporting roles) as there were particularly many of his decedents who played Wakikata (supporting roles) (although some do not trust "Yoza yakusha mokuroku").
He may have been the master of Waki (supporting roles) as there were particularly many of his decedents who played Wakikata (supporting roles) (although some did not trust "Yoza yakusha mokuroku").
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It was also said that he may have been a master of Waki (supporting actor) since his decedents had produced particularly many Wakikata (supporting actor) (Some opinions, including this one, did not rely on the description of "Yoza yakusha mokuroku").
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: 後述のように能作者として活動したほか、過去の謡曲の保存・継承にも心を砕いた。
sen.e: Besides being a good noh play writer who wrote many plays, as stated below, he spent a lot of time restoring old Yokyoku (noh songs) so that they could be handed down to later generations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: Besides being a good noh play writer who wrote many plays, as stated below, he spent a lot of time restoring old Yokyoku (noh songs) so that they could be handed down to later generations.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Besides being active as a noh playwright to be described below, he devoted to put age-old Yokyoku (noh songs) to written text so that they could be handed down to later generations.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 二百余りの作品を「青表紙本」と呼ばれる形で整理したと伝えられる。
sen.e: It is said that he organized some two hundreds of yokyoku into a book called "Aobyoshibon (literally, blue covered transcription)".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: It is said that he organized some two hundred yokyoku in a book called "Aobyoshibon (literally, blue covered transcription)".
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is said that he organized some two hundred yokyoku in a book called "Aobyoshibon (literally, blue covered transcription)".
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 老境に至るまで大夫の補佐役として第一線で活躍し、「権守」の称号を受けた。
sen.e: Nobumitsu, who was active on the front lines throughout his life until he grew old while supporting the tayu, was awarded the title of Gonno kami (a title given to those who excelled at a wide range of performances).

Nobumitsu, who was active on the front lines throughout his life supporting the tayu, until he grew old was awarded the title of Gonno kami (a title given to those who excelled at a wide range of performances).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Nobumitsu was active until ripe old age on the front lines assisting tayu, and awarded the title of 'Gonno kami' (a title given to those who excelled at a wide range of performances).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: 乱世を越えて音阿弥家、ひいては観世流が栄える礎を作った人物として高く評価される。
sen.e: He is credited with laying the foundation for not only the Onami family but also the Kanze ryu school to flourish over turbulent times.
He is credited with laying the foundation for not only the Onami family but also the Kanze ryu school to flourish over turbulent times.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was valued highly as a person who laid the groundwork for not only the Onami family but also the Kanze school to survive and thrive in turbulent times.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: また晩年に書かれた「観世小次郎信光画像讃」ではその生涯とともに、観世家の出自が詳しく語られ、近代に至るまで観世家を語る上での基礎資料として認知されていた。
sen.e: "Kanzekojiro Nobumitsu ga zo-san", which was written in his later years, also describes in detail the root of the Kanze family as well as his life; this book has been considered one of the most authoritative books on the history of Kanze family up to the present day.

"Kanzekojiro Nobumitsu ga zo-san," written in his later years, also describes, in detail, the roots of the Kanze family as well as his own life; this book has been considered one of the most authoritative books on the history written on the Kanze family up to the present.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Since 'KANZE Kojiro Nobumitsu ga zo-san,' which was written in his later years, described the roots of the Kanze family as well as his own life in detail, this book has been considered source materials about the Kanze family up to the present.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直し、表記を変えました。

sen.j: 息子に観世長俊、信重、元供がいる。
sen.e: He had three sons: Nagatoshi, Nobushige, and Mototomo.
He had three sons: Nagatoshi, Nobushige, and Mototomo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He had sons Nagatoshi, Nobushige, and Mototomo KANZE.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。

tit.j: 能作者として多くの作品を書いた。
tit.e: As a noh play writer, he wrote many plays.
As a noh play writer, he wrote many plays.
As a noh playwright, he wrote many noh plays.
tit.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 信光の作品は、おおむね華やかでわかりやすく劇的展開にみちている。
sen.e: Generally, his stories are colorful, easy to understand, and filled with dramatic developments.
Generally, his stories are colorful, easy to understand, and filled with dramatic developments.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Most of Nobumitsu's works were full of spectacular, explicit and dramatic developments.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 「幽玄」を時に過剰なまでに追求した世阿弥・観世元雅の作品とは対照的に、信光の作品は、ショー的要素、同時代でいう｢風流（ふりゅう）｣を多く取り入れた華やかな作品が多い。
sen.e: In contrast to the plays written by Zeami and Motomasa KANZE, who at times excessively pursued the world of "Yugen (the subtle and profound)", his works are more entertaining, elegant, and full of refined tastes of that time.

In contrast to the plays written by Zeami and Motomasa KANZE, who at times excessively pursued the world of "Yugen (the subtle and profound)," his works are more entertaining, elegant, and full of refined tastes of that time.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: In contrast to the works of Zeami and Motomasa KANZE, in which 'yugen' (elegance, calm, profundity, mixed with the feeling of mutability) was sometimes too much expressed, many Nobumitsu's works were spectacular filled with sensational events which were called 'furyu' (full of refined tastes) in those days.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: これは、信光は、応仁の乱を経験する時代に生きた。
sen.e: This was because Nobumichi lived in the era of Onin War (1467–77, civil war in the Kyoto region, that began in the Onin period (1467–68) and was a prelude to a prolonged period of domestic strife (1490–1590)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理応仁の乱の説明が長くなったため、例外処理をさせていただきました。
sen.e: This was because Nobumichi lived in the era of Onin War (1467–77, civil war in the Kyoto region, that began in the Onin period (1467–68) and was a prelude to a prolonged period of domestic strife (1490–1590)).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This was because Nobumitsu lived in the era of Onin War (1467-77, civil war in the Kyoto region began in the Onin period (1467-68) and was a prelude to a prolonged period of domestic strife (1490-1590)).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 上流武家、公家のバックアップを受けていた世阿弥時代に比べて、そのような層の後援が減り、地方興行も多く、幽玄よりもスペクタクル性が求められたためといわれている。
sen.e: Compared to the era of Zeami, noh schools, that received less support from high-ranking samurai families and nobles, were forced to perform more locally, where audience preferred entertainment and spectacles to the world of 'yugen'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: Compared to the era of Zeami, noh schools, that received less support from high-ranking samurai families and nobles, were forced to perform more locally, where audiences preferred entertainment and spectacles to the world of 'yugen'.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Compared to the time of Zeami when noh schools received support from high-ranking samurai families and nobles, noh schools in the time of Nobumitsu received less support and were forced to perform more frequently in provinces where audiences preferred spectacle to yugen.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: この芸風は息子長俊に受け継がれ、彼もまた能作者として活躍している。
sen.e: His style was taken over by his son, Nagatoshi, who also wrote many plays as a noh play writer.
His style was taken over by his son, Nagatoshi, who also wrote many plays as a noh play writer.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His style was inherited by his son Nagatoshi who was also active as a noh playwright.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

tit.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 船弁慶
sen.e: Funa Benkei (literally, "Boat Benkei" (warrior-monk whose legendary superhuman exploits in the service of his master, the famous warrior Minamoto Yoshitsune)
Funa Benkei (literally, "Boat Benkei" (warrior-monk whose legendary superhuman exploits in the service of his master, the famous warrior Minamoto Yoshitsune)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Funa Benkei (Benkei in the Boat; warrior-monk Benkei used his legendary superhuman powers in the service of his master, the famous warrior Minamoto no Yoshitsune)
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: 紅葉狩 (能)
sen.e: Momijigari (literally, colored leaf-viewing) (noh play)
Momijigari (literally, colored leaf-viewing) (noh play)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Momijigari (Maple Viewing) (noh play)
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 鐘巻（道成寺能『道成寺』 の原型）
sen.e: Kanemaki (literally, "twining around a temple bell", the original story of "Dojo-ji Temple")
Kanemaki (literally, "twining around a temple bell," the original story of "Dojo-ji Temple")
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Kanemaki (Coiling around a temple bell; the original version of the noh play "Dojo-ji Temple")
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: 遊行柳
sen.e: Yugyoyanagi (literally, "Yugo shonin (a saint) and a willow")
Yugyoyanagi (literally, "Yugo shonin (a saint) and a willow")
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Yugyoyanagi (The Priest and the Willow)
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
